title: Reporting/plot_corr needs "exclude"
body:
First off, make sure to check your [support options](https://github.com/autonomio/talos#-how-to-get-support).

The preferred way to resolve usage related matters is through the [docs](https://autonomio.github.io/talos/#/) which are maintained up-to-date with the latest version of Talos.

If you do end up asking for support in a new issue, make sure to follow the below steps carefully.

#### 1) Confirm the below

- [x] I have looked for an answer in the [Docs](https://autonomio.github.io/talos)
- [x] My Python version is 3.5 or higher
- [x] I have searched through the issues [Issues](https://github.com/autonomio/talos/issues) for a duplicate
- [x] I've tested that my Keras model works as a stand-alone

#### 2) Include the output of:

`talos.__version__`=0.6.6

#### 3) Explain clearly what you are trying to achieve

I want to plot the correlations from "val_loss" with all paramters:
`r = talos.Reporting(file)
r.plot_hist(metric='val_loss',bins=30)
r.plot_corr('val_loss',exclude='lossfunction')
plt.show()` 

I got the error that I have to use "exclude", but I really donÂ´t know in which manner it would be appropriate. The code seems to need a list, but when I give him a list, it does not work.

#### 4) Explain what you have already tried

It tried something like this:

1. `r.plot_corr('val_loss',exclude='lossfunction')` -->TypeError: can only concatenate str (not "list") to str
2. `r.plot_corr('val_loss',exclude=['lossfunction'])` --> ValueError: zero-size array to reduction operation minimum which has no identity
3. `r.plot_corr(metric='val_loss',exclude=[])` --> "

So, the model and hyperparameter tuning works, it is just about the visualization. Hence, to focus on the problem, I have not included the model and whole code. If this is necessary, please let me know!

#### 5) Provide a code-complete reference

- [ ] My support question includes an input model
- [ ] My support question includes a parameter dictionary
- [ ] My support question includes a `Scan()` command
- [ ] My support question includes a link to a sample of the data

NOTE: If the data is sensitive and can't be shared, [create dummy data](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/classes.html#samples-generator) that mimics it.

**A self-contained Jupyter Notebook, Google Colab, or similar is highly preferred and will speed up helping you with your issue.**

---
